name: linkedin
description: LinkedIn is a professional networking platform enabling job seekers, companies, and thought leaders to connect, share content, and discover business opportunities

tools.name: LINKEDIN_CREATE_LINKED_IN_POST
tools.description: Creates a new post on LinkedIn for the authenticated user or an organization they manage; ensure the user has necessary permissions if posting for an organization.

author.title: Author
author.description: The URN of the LinkedIn member or organization creating the post. Use the GET_USER_INFO action to retrieve the 'author_id' (URN) for the authenticated user. For an organization, the URN will be in the format 'urn:li:organization:{id}'.

commentary.title: Commentary
examples: Excited to share our new product update!
commentary.description: The main text content of the post. This field supports plain text and @-mentions (e.g., @[LinkedIn Member](urn:li:person:xxxx)). Maximum length: 3000 characters.

visibility.title: Visibility
visibility.description: Controls who can see the post. 'PUBLIC' makes it visible to everyone, 'CONNECTIONS' to connections only, 'LOGGED_IN' to signed-in LinkedIn members, and 'CONTAINER' for specific group/event posts.

distribution.title: Distribution

targetEntities.title: Target Entities
targetEntities.description: A list of entities to target with this post. Each entity should be a dictionary. This is often used for targeted distribution, e.g., to specific groups or GeoLocations. For GeoLocations, provide a dictionary like: `{'geoLocations': [{'geo': 'urn:li:geo:103644278'}]}`. Refer to LinkedIn documentation for specific URN formats.

feedDistribution.title: Feed Distribution
feedDistribution.description: Specifies how the post is distributed on the LinkedIn feed. 'MAIN_FEED' distributes to the main feed, 'NONE' creates Direct Sponsored Content and requires adContext.dscAdAccount (adContext parameter not exposed in this action).

thirdPartyDistributionChannels.title: Third Party Distribution Channels
thirdPartyDistributionChannels.description: A list of third-party channels where the post should be distributed, e.g., Twitter. Refer to LinkedIn documentation for supported channels.

distribution.description: Specifies distribution rules for the post, including feed distribution and targeting.

lifecycleState.title: Lifecycle State
lifecycleState.description: The state of the post. Use 'PUBLISHED' to post directly, 'DRAFT' to save as a draft, or 'PUBLISH_REQUESTED' if the post requires review before publishing.

isReshareDisabledByAuthor.title: Is Reshare Disabled By Author
isReshareDisabledByAuthor.description: Set to true to prevent others from resharing this post.

tools.name: LINKEDIN_DELETE_LINKED_IN_POST
tools.description: Deletes a specific LinkedIn post (share) by its unique `share_id`, which must correspond to an existing share.

share_id.title: Share Id
share_id.description: Unique identifier of the LinkedIn share (post) to be deleted.

tools.name: LINKEDIN_GET_COMPANY_INFO
tools.description: Retrieves organizations where the authenticated user has specific roles (ACLs), to determine their management or content posting capabilities for LinkedIn company pages.

inputSchema.title: GetCompanyInfoRequest

role.title: Role
role.description: The specific role to filter organization ACLs by.

count.title: Count
count.description: The number of organization ACLs to return per page.

start.title: Start
start.description: The starting index for pagination, representing the number of initial ACLs to skip.

state.title: State
state.description: The approval state of the role to filter by.

inputSchema.description: Parameters for listing organizations where the authenticated user has specific roles and permissions (ACLs).

tools.name: LINKEDIN_GET_MY_INFO
tools.description: Fetches the authenticated LinkedIn user's profile, notably including the 'author_id' required for attributing content such as posts or articles.
